javax.mvc.validation

Interface ValidationResult

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<javax.validation.ConstraintViolation<?>>

    public interface ValidationResult
extends Iterable<javax.validation.ConstraintViolation<?>>

    Describes the validation result of all resource fields and resource method parameters which are annotated with Valid.

    Controller methods which declare a parameter of this type will be executed even if the validation for fields and method parameters fails.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Christian Kaltepoth

    • Method Detail

      • isFailed

        boolean isFailed()
        Returns true if there is at least one constraint violation. Same as checking whether getViolationCount() is greater than zero.
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one constraint violation.

      • getViolationCount

        int getViolationCount()
        Returns the total number of constraint violations detected. Same as calling getAllViolations().size().
        Returns:
        The number of constraint violations

      • getAllViolations

        Set<javax.validation.ConstraintViolation<?>> getAllViolations()
        Returns an immutable set of all constraint violations detected.
        Returns:
        All constraint violations detected

      • getViolations

        Set<javax.validation.ConstraintViolation<?>> getViolations(String propertyPath)
        Returns an immutable set of all constraint violations detected for a property specified by the given property path.
        Parameters:
        propertyPath - The property path (e.g. person.age)
        Returns:
        All constraint violations detected
        See Also:
        getViolation(String)

      • getViolation

        javax.validation.ConstraintViolation<?> getViolation(String propertyPath)
        Returns a single constraint violation detected for a property specified by the given property path. Will return the first violation if there are more than one detected and null if no violation was detected.
        Parameters:
        propertyPath - The property path (e.g. person.age)
        Returns:
        The first constraint violation or null if there are no violations.
